a1: ASCII art is a graphic design technique that uses printable characters to create images and text banners. It has been used since the early days of computing.
a2: Letters A-Z, digits 0-9, and basic punctuation (! ? .). The tool automatically converts input to uppercase.
q3: Can I use it in code comments?
a3: Yes! ASCII art banners are commonly used in code comments, README files, and terminal output to create visual section headers.
a4: You can choose from block (â–ˆ), hash (#), star (*), at (@), dollar ($), and zero (0) characters.
